header: ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. BAIL APPLICATION No. 27/2019 (Shubham Vinod Kamble Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000215­2019

background.text: 1) This is an application for grant of pre­arrest bail in connection with C.R. No. 430/2018 registered with Shahupuri police station Satara for the offences punishable under sections 394, 504 and 506 r/w. 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under sections 394, 504 and 506 r/w. 34 of indian penal code

arguments.text: 2) According to the prosecution case, on 15/09/2018 at Radhika Chowk at about 8:30 p.m. when the first informant was proceeding towards S.T. stand to see Ganapati festival decorations. At that time, the present applicant and his associates Rahul Kadam, Vijay Kamble and Rais Aatar were chitchatting at Radhika Chowk. The present applicant called the first informant and taken him on the motorbike of Rais Aatar towards one farm and made demand of Rs.5,000/­ with the first informant. The first informant refused to satisfy their demand as he was not having sufficient money at that time. The applicant and his associates got annoyed and then started assaulting the first informant and snatched Rs. 200/­ from his trouser pocket and his mobile handset worth of Rs. 4,000/­. Though the first informant rushed to Shahupuri police station Satara for lodging report against the present applicant and his associates.

argumentSentences.text: 2) According to the prosecution case, on 15/09/2018 at Radhika Chowk at about 8:30 p.m. when the first informant was proceeding towards S.T. stand to see Ganapati festival decorations.
At that time, the present applicant and his associates Rahul Kadam, Vijay Kamble and Rais Aatar were chitchatting at Radhika Chowk.
The present applicant called the first informant and taken him on the motorbike of Rais Aatar towards one farm and made demand of Rs.5,000/­ with the first informant.
The first informant refused to satisfy their demand as he was not having sufficient money at that time.
The applicant and his associates got annoyed and then started assaulting the first informant and snatched Rs. 200/­ from his trouser pocket and his mobile handset worth of Rs. 4,000/­.
Though the first informant rushed to Shahupuri police station Satara for lodging report against the present applicant and his associates.

arguments.text: 3) It is the contention of applicant that, the FIR has been lodged against present applicant on false and frivolous grounds. The applicant is no way concern with any of the co­accused or the alleged incident. The applicant is local resident of Budhwar Peth, Satara. Investigating Officer has already submitted the charge­ sheet against the accused persons and the presence of applicant for further interrogation at the hands of police is not warranted.

argumentSentences.text: 3) It is the contention of applicant that, the FIR has been lodged against present applicant on false and frivolous grounds.
The applicant is no way concern with any of the co­accused or the alleged incident.
The applicant is local resident of Budhwar Peth, Satara.
Investigating Officer has already submitted the charge­ sheet against the accused persons and the presence of applicant for further interrogation at the hands of police is not warranted.

arguments.text: 4) The prosecution filed reply and strongly objected to grant order of pre­arrest bail in favour of applicant. It is contended that, the antecedents of present applicant is not spot less. The present applicant has been involved in the crimes registered with Satara City police station C.R. No. 949/2013 and Shahupuri police station Satara bearing C.R. Nos. 36/2015, 129/2015, 884/2016 and 20/2017 for having being committed the offences punishable under sections 307, 394, 325, 392 etc. of Indian Penal Code, 1860. The applicant has been externed from Satara, Koregaon, Jawali, Wai and Karad Taluka for the period of 2 years. Despite of that, he has committed present crime while the externment order was in force.

argumentSentences.text: 4) The prosecution filed reply and strongly objected to grant order of pre­arrest bail in favour of applicant.
It is contended that, the antecedents of present applicant is not spot less.

The present applicant has been involved in the crimes registered with Satara City police station C.R. No. 949/2013 and Shahupuri police station Satara bearing C.R. Nos. 36/2015, 129/2015, 884/2016 and 20/2017 for having being committed the offences punishable under sections 307, 394, 325, 392 etc. of Indian Penal Code, 1860.
The applicant has been externed from Satara, Koregaon, Jawali, Wai and Karad Taluka for the period of 2 years.
Despite of that, he has committed present crime while the externment order was in force.

arguments.text: 5) Heard the Ld. APP for the State. Perusal of FIR, it discloses that, there is direct allegations against the present applicant. The first informant has assigned key role to the present applicant, at the instance of this applicant. All the miscreants took the first informant towards the farm and assaulted him by fist and kick of blows and made demand of Rs. 5,000/­. Upon refusal, they snatched cash of Rs. 200/­ and mobile handset worth of Rs.4,000/­. Thus, the complicity of the present applicant in the crime clearly revealed. Considering the antecedents as shown by the police of Shahupuri police station Satara in their reply. Therefore only because the charge­sheet has been filed by the Investigating Officer against the accused persons is not the valid ground to enlarge present applicant especially pre­arrest bail.

argumentSentences.text: 5) Heard the Ld. APP for the State.
Perusal of FIR, it discloses that, there is direct allegations against the present applicant.
The first informant has assigned key role to the present applicant, at the instance of this applicant.
All the miscreants took the first informant towards the farm and assaulted him by fist and kick of blows and made demand of Rs. 5,000/­.
Upon refusal, they snatched cash of Rs. 200/­ and mobile handset worth of Rs.4,000/­.
Thus, the complicity of the present applicant in the crime clearly revealed.
Considering the antecedents as shown by the police of Shahupuri police station Satara in their reply.
Therefore only because the charge­sheet has been filed by the Investigating Officer against the accused persons is not the valid ground to enlarge present applicant especially pre­arrest bail.

arguments.text: 6) In this backdrop, the accusation made against the applicant in the FIR and the documents collected by the Investigating Officer till the date, the applicant has not made out case to grant order of Anticipatory Bail in his favour. Hence, order.

argumentSentences.text: 6) In this backdrop, the accusation made against the applicant in the FIR and the documents collected by the Investigating Officer till the date, the applicant has not made out case to grant order of Anticipatory Bail in his favour.
Hence, order.

order.text: ORDER 1) Criminal Bail Application No. 27/2019, stands rejected. \2) Ad­interim order dated 17/01/2019 granted in favour of the the applicant is hereby vacated. 3) Application is disposed­of accordingly.

footer: (N.L. More) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 10th June, 2019. Satara
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. BAIL APPLICATION No. 27/2019 (Shubham Vinod Kamble Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000215­2019 
---header-ends---
1) This is an application for grant of pre­arrest bail in connection with C.R. No. 430/2018 registered with Shahupuri police station Satara for the offences punishable under sections 394, 504 and 506 r/w. 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860. 
---background-ends---
2) According to the prosecution case, on 15/09/2018 at Radhika Chowk at about 8:30 p.m. when the first informant was proceeding towards S.T. stand to see Ganapati festival decorations. At that time, the present applicant and his associates Rahul Kadam, Vijay Kamble and Rais Aatar were chitchatting at Radhika Chowk. The present applicant called the first informant and taken him on the motorbike of Rais Aatar towards one farm and made demand of Rs.5,000/­ with the first informant. The first informant refused to satisfy their demand as he was not having sufficient money at that time. The applicant and his associates got annoyed and then started assaulting the first informant and snatched Rs. 200/­ from his trouser pocket and his mobile handset worth of Rs. 4,000/­. Though the first informant rushed to Shahupuri police station Satara for lodging report against the present applicant and his associates. 
---argument-ends---
3) It is the contention of applicant that, the FIR has been lodged against present applicant on false and frivolous grounds. The applicant is no way concern with any of the co­accused or the alleged incident. The applicant is local resident of Budhwar Peth, Satara. Investigating Officer has already submitted the charge­ sheet against the accused persons and the presence of applicant for further interrogation at the hands of police is not warranted. 
---argument-ends---
4) The prosecution filed reply and strongly objected to grant order of pre­arrest bail in favour of applicant. It is contended that, the antecedents of present applicant is not spot less. The present applicant has been involved in the crimes registered with Satara City police station C.R. No. 949/2013 and Shahupuri police station Satara bearing C.R. Nos. 36/2015, 129/2015, 884/2016 and 20/2017 for having being committed the offences punishable under sections 307, 394, 325, 392 etc. of Indian Penal Code, 1860. The applicant has been externed from Satara, Koregaon, Jawali, Wai and Karad Taluka for the period of 2 years. Despite of that, he has committed present crime while the externment order was in force. 
---argument-ends---
5) Heard the Ld. APP for the State. Perusal of FIR, it discloses that, there is direct allegations against the present applicant. The first informant has assigned key role to the present applicant, at the instance of this applicant. All the miscreants took the first informant towards the farm and assaulted him by fist and kick of blows and made demand of Rs. 5,000/­. Upon refusal, they snatched cash of Rs. 200/­ and mobile handset worth of Rs.4,000/­. Thus, the complicity of the present applicant in the crime clearly revealed. Considering the antecedents as shown by the police of Shahupuri police station Satara in their reply. Therefore only because the charge­sheet has been filed by the Investigating Officer against the accused persons is not the valid ground to enlarge present applicant especially pre­arrest bail. 
---argument-ends---
6) In this backdrop, the accusation made against the applicant in the FIR and the documents collected by the Investigating Officer till the date, the applicant has not made out case to grant order of Anticipatory Bail in his favour. Hence, order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1) Criminal Bail Application No. 27/2019, stands rejected. \2) Ad­interim order dated 17/01/2019 granted in favour of the the applicant is hereby vacated. 3) Application is disposed­of accordingly. 
---order-ends---
(N.L. More) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 10th June, 2019. Satara
